comments.commentBody: Clinton will bring us a ground war in Syria and more U.S. aggression on Russia's border if not an outright effort at "regime change" in Russia. Clinton "admires" Kissinger, the USA's most heinous war criminal, who undoubtedly is advising these policies. You tell me what is worse than nuclear annihilation.
Just wait for Barrack on Wednesday, hoo boy...

I'm an independent who tends to vote Republican.

Michelle Obama, Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren blew me away tonight!

So much better than last week's amateur hour.
I've actually wondered if some of the most vocal agitators aren't just Trump/Putin moles.

Hopefully someone will hear you above the Booos -- and then actually take time to connect the dots between the President+Congress+the Supreme Court, and what that will mean if Trump is elected...
Think it's asking too much????
listen, then, to CSPAN for just the program, and all of the program

There is no real rational case for any Democrat or Independent to vote for Trump unless the change you want is quasi-fascism. Hillary will win and deservedly so, because the majority doenst want a fascist as the ruler of the free world. " This is a change election year. One that is overdue." What are you talking about - as if electing President Obama wasn't a monumental change? The only change we need now is to vote out obstructionist Republicans in Congress.

You can keep bleating about the party not being united in your copious replies but tonight I saw a party uniting after a hard-fought campaign over actual issues as opposed to the Republican schoolyard silliness.
It seems that you do not understand that about 80% of Bernie voters are voting for Hillary.  You seem to think it is zero.

Mark Thomason,
Keep writing-- people need to think for themselves and try to get over the anti-Trump hysteria. They need to understand the Clinton actual deeds vs. the pretty-sounding ads and speeches. "Clinton Cash" is a good place to start; it's an hour-long documentary, free on You Tube. We've got to have truthful leadership at the top to save our country. Clinton/Obama can implement a lot of what Trump says. (Example: google pictures of the partial wall or walls that already exist on the border with Mexico.)

Bernie's speech was fantastic. He did great job to unite the party. I as a die hard Democrat, I am grateful. Still Trump will try to influence some of his supporters. Trump may spend money and engage his people to pretend as Bernie supporters for Trump. The biggest problem is that most of the Bernie supporters are between 18 to 26 years old and this the first time they are in presidential election. Some of them do not understand the degree of importance of Supreme Court judge and TPP and that is the problem. Most important issue at stake in this election Supreme Court and federal judges appointment.

Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump are the candidates along with the Green Party candidate.  Bottom line is that Bernie is not the Democratic nominee and will not be. For those Bernie supporters who still say they can't vote for Hillary, for whatever reason, quit being spoilers, and vote your conscience, but don't disrupt the convention. You have a right to vote for whoever you want, but stop being spoilers!

You posted this four hours ago, before the prime time speakers, including Sanders.

You spoke too soon.
She will not lose. She is smart, strong and capable and will make a good President. Your ideology will lose though...so watch out.

I will never support a corrupt politician like Hillary who threatens our democracy by rigging primaries.  She is dishonest.  I will vote for Trump and divert my energies from Bernie to Trump in swing states.  He is less of a war monger then her.  Hillary is destructive.
Uh, no, Andrew, you can vote for Hilary and still care for the issues Bernie has (thankfully) championed. You see: a vote for Hilary, being a vote against Trump, is merely a vote for sanity.

"spending the next four years working for better policies and candidates" won't work, won't happen, if Hillary and her minions control the DNC. We just saw that. So no, Hillary must lose, lose control of the whole Party, which means lose the election. That isn't so much of a loss, because she really isn't much better than anything Trump would manage to do (if anything).

Genuine Bernie supporters would not be spending time echoing Rush Limbaugh about the DNC and Clinton. Instead, they will be organizing for November's elections, especially for Congress and state legislatures. It matters who will appoint Supreme Court Justices and who will control state legislatures that will gerrymander Congressional and state legislative districts after the 2020 census, with its decade long effect.

Sanders and Trump have largely drawn from parallel pools of dissatisfaction with business-as-usual. I take Sanders supporters at their word and do not believe they are interested in forming a circular firing squad, which is what they would be doing, if all the Recommends and signs and marchers were actually Bernie people and not Republican trolls drumming up support for their boy, Trump.

Sanders supporters have three choices: organize and vote for Clinton, spending the next four years working for better policies and candidates; help Trump by voting for Stein, Johnson, or no one and spend the next four years watching things go further down the toilet; or, they can live in a fantasy world.

Donald "Let's Make A Deal" Trump admires Putin and won't commit to NATO in the face of a possible Russian attack. Remember the deal the Republicans made with Iran to keep Reagan from losing to Carter. (Times; "New Reports Say 1980 Reagan Campaign Tried to Delay Hostage Release"; April 14, 1991.) Think it a coincidence these e-mails were hacked by Russia before the convention?

"The arrogance of Hillary to have Debbie Wasserman Schultz to speak at the DNC" (a sentiment voiced by many commenters here). The very person caught at the helm of rigging the Democratic Primaries!  What was Hillary thinking?! This is bad on so many levels.

Seb -- you seem to completely misunderstand how we got here:

1. Who was president until 2008? What party was in control? What happened?

2. Who got elected in 2008, beating HRC for the Democratic nomination? What has his signature campaign promise? What did the Democrats actually deliver in his first term?

3. What happened in the 2010 election? Why do you think it happened?

Pssst ... right now, who controls the House and Senate? What do you think the outcome of this election will be as to the control of the house and senate? What are you doing to make any of that happen?

And then just exactly what do you expect Trump to do as President?

Seriously??? How does voting for Hillary produce a Trump/Putin presidency?

And you should pay attention. Bernie gave HRC his unqualified endorsement and said he's proud to stand with here.

I dont know what you're on about, the RNC was a massive success. There were exactly 2 hiccups: and they were relatively minor. The NeverTrump people tried to force a delegate vote, and failed, very early on, and Ted Cruz snubbed Trump and didnt endorse him, committing political suicide in the process.

Aside from that, it was a pretty good show of a unified party, with unified goals.

Unlike the DNC so far, which only a day or so in, has the crowd divided between Clinton and Bernie supporters, and Sarah Silverman actually insulting them live on national TV, then saying "we can edit it in post".

The fact that there were chants of "Bernie" in the convention hall, and not Hillary, is hardly a good example.
That's because we haven't forgotten which country we live in

@forever
Ok you had your say. This is how "real life" works.
You win some. You lose some.
Compromise is a two-way street -- and not a dirty word.
Now, grow up.
What about her finger on the button?
Bernie was brilliant.  Sadly, the better candidate was not chosen.  Bravo, Bernie and thank you for a wonderful ride.  I'm looking forward to the next chapter of the political revolution.
Bernie probably knows that in doing that he surrendered all power to help Hillary. Perhaps that pleases him. He just goes back to the Senate, and lets her drown in what she's done.

Although letting go was hard to do Bernie delivered!  In spades. He exquisitely and cleverly kept using Hillary's name so as to identify her with his favorite policies not only to help his supporters make the switch from him to her but also I would imagine to make it hard for the Hillary team to back off or back down.  Overall there was a satisfying sense of Unity lost, Unity found.
Ancient history.  Bernie is all in for Hillary.  Deal with it.
Who cares one way or the other?

That is fine. Then go.  Start your own party, and let us know what your platform is.  Maybe I and others will join you, but as of now, one of two people will be President,  Clinton or Trump, not Jill Stein or anyone else.  Faced with the choice of Hillary or Trump, I choose Hillary.

gee where's your head.  This is a revolution of ideas.  A revolution of change: in the Democratic party process.  A revolution to take back the tools of governing and procedure to make America a strong middle class country.

What Hillary needs to excuse herself as the lesser evil is the Bush Admin record. No economic successes. No foreign policy successes. Took 3.9% unemployment to 500,000 job losses a month.
I will vote for a liar to avoid that result.

Do you really want a revolution, Bernie supporters? Do you want blood on the streets? Do you have the guts to kill, torture and jail people who disagree with you - people like me? Do you want cities going up in flames? Do you want the economy to collapse? Because this is what a revolution looks like. You are a minority among the Democrats and even a smaller minority among the American people as a whole. You have lost. Accept the defeat gracefully, as Sanders himself did, or be upfront about it and tell us what you really want and how you are going to get it.

"Trump would be worse? No. He could not get much worse past the Senate."
The Commander-in-Chief does not need the senate to command out troops. Just sayin'

"Hillary's Supreme Court picks would be like her VP pick... nothing to brag about"?

After Merrick Garland, I'd lay odds her next pick will be Barack Obama!
Who wouldn't be uptight with Jake Tapper.
Hurray for Sarah Silverman stating the obvious: "You Bernie or bust people are being ridiculous." She might have added two words to that statement: "Supreme Court."
